page.description: Moves the focus to the object to the right, as if the user pressed the "Right" cursor key.
page.original:
&ltOBJECT>.RIGHT() Syntax &ltOBJECT>.RIGHT() Description The &ltOBJECT>.RIGHT() method applies to:
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.RIGHT() method moves the focus to the right as if the user had pressed the "Right" key. Limitations Desktop applications only. Example dim ptr as P ptr = form.view("Customer Information") ptr.right()
See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
